messages.subject: Re: Herbal Rituals book
messages.msgSnippet: i ve continued with the sage -- vinegars, tea, smudge sticks, etc. -- and am now moving on to thyme.  i just started a large jar of thyme honey, and i m
messages.messageBody:
i've continued with the sage -- vinegars, tea, smudge sticks, etc. --
and am now moving on to thyme. i just started a large jar of thyme
honey, and i'm curious -- how much thyme honey did you take as a
prophylactic against respiratory junk? (my little one's coming down
with another cold today, and i'm spooning him a bit of the honey, even
tho it's not "done" yet. hope it works to fight colds, too!)

Julie wrote:
> We have been using the "thyme honey" (I think I got it out of this
book) for over a year and none of the 7 of us have had one respiratory
infection.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Herbal Rituals book
messages.msgSnippet: and i ve been ... Burn sage for clarity of mind Burn sage to purify the spirit Burn sage to cleanse the atmosphere ....... There immuno benifits from
messages.messageBody:
and i've been
> working with sage ever since.
> next week, thyme. thanks!

"Burn sage for clarity of mind" "Burn sage to purify
the spirit" "Burn sage to cleanse the atmosphere"
....... There immuno benifits from infusions and for
use as a spice in foods. What do you use it for?
Mostly, I just like the scent....

???????

SOS

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Herbal Rituals book
messages.msgSnippet: three days ago i was browsing at the bookstore when i came across a copy of this book.  i recognized the title because of your recent post.   i couldn t stop
messages.messageBody:
three days ago i was browsing at the bookstore when i came across a copy of
this book. i recognized the title because of your recent post. i couldn't
stop myself from buying a copy, and i've been working with sage ever since.
next week, thyme. thanks!

messages.subject: Re: Herbal Rituals book
messages.messageBody:
<<<<Hi Meghan,

Yes, Judith Berger is the author. I love my copy and
I hope you enjoy it as well. We have been using the
"thyme honey" (I think I got it out of this book) for
over a year and none of the 7 of us have had one
respiratory infection.

Julie>>>>

Thanks Julie,
I'm going to go ahead and order it now that I know
it's the same one.

Meghan

messages.subject: Herbal Rituals book
messages.msgSnippet: Julie, Is Judith Berger the author of this book? I found a book about herbal rituals by her and was wondering if it was the book you were talking about. Meghan
messages.messageBody:
Julie,
Is Judith Berger the author of this book? I found a
book about herbal rituals by her and was wondering if
it was the book you were talking about.

Meghan :-)

<<<<<Message: 22
Date: Mon, 3 Dec 2001 21:47:43 -0800 (PST)
From: meghan anderson <moonmeghan@...>
Subject: Re: herbal book

<<<<<I stumbled across a book called "Herbal Rituals".
This book is written month by month. The author talks
almost poetically about the rhythms of
nature, noticing them, very intimate moments in her
life with nature and sharing her love of the earth
with children.
Julie--who is so very glad to be here>>>>>

Julie,
Do you know the author of this book? I would LOVE to
get a hold of a copy!
TIA
Meghan>>>>
